Value.label: Motion Re-trigger Time
Value.Help: This parameter is configured the delay time before PIR sensor can be triggered again to reset motion timeout counter. Value = 0 will disable PIR sensor from triggering until motion timeout has finished.

Value.label: Motion clear time
Value.Help: This configures the clear time when your motion sensor times out and sends a no motion status.

Value.label: Motion Sensitivity
Value.Help: This parameter is configured the sensitivity that motion detect. 0 - PIR sensor disabled. 1 - Lowest sensitivity. 11 - Highest sensitivity.

Value.label: Binary Sensor Report
Value.Help: Enable/disable sensor binary report when motion event is detected or cleared

Value.label: Disable BASIC_SET to Associated nodes
Value.Help: This parameter is configured the enabled or disabled send BASIC_SET command to nodes that associated in group 2 and group 3.

Item.label: Disabled All Group Basic Set Command

Value.label: Basic Set Value Settings for Group 2
Value.Help: Define Basic Set Value when motion event is triggered and / or cleared

Item.label: 0xFF when motion is triggered and 0x00 when motion is cleared
0x00 when motion is triggered and 0xFF when motion is cleared

Value.label: Temperature Alarm Value
Value.Help: This parameter is configured the threshold value that alarm level for temperature. When the current ambient temperature value is larger than this configuration value, device will send a BASIC_SET = 0xFF to nodes associated in group 3. If current temperature value is less than this value, device will send a BASIC_SET = 0x00 to nodes associated in group 3. Value = [Value] x 0.1(Celsius / Fahrenheit) Available Settings: -400 to 850 (40.0 to 85.0 Celsius) or -400 to 1185 (-40.0 to 118.5 Fahrenheit). Default value: 239 (23.9 Celsius) or 750 (75.0 Fahrenheit)

Value.label: LED over TriSensor
Value.Help: Enable or Disable LED over TriSensor This completely disables all LED reaction regardless of Parameter 9 - 13 settings

Value.label: Motion report LED
Value.Help: This setting changes the color of the LED when your TriSensor sends a motion report.

Value.label: Temperature report LED
Value.Help: This setting changes the color of the LED when your TriSensor sends a temperature report.

Value.label: Light report LED
Value.Help: This setting changes the color of the LED when your TriSensor sends a light report.

Value.label: Battery report LED
Value.Help: It is possible to change the color of what the LED blinks when your TriSensor sends a battery report.

Value.label: Wakeup report LED
Value.Help: This setting changes the color of the LED when your TriSensor sends a wakeup report.

Value.label: Temperature Scale Setting
Value.Help: Configure temperature sensor scale type, Temperature to report in Celsius or Fahrenheit

Value.label: Temperature Threshold reporting
Value.Help: Change threshold value for change in temperature to induce an automatic report for temperature sensor. Scale is identical setting in Parameter No.20. 0-> Disable Threshold Report for Temperature Sensor. Setting of value 20 can be a change of -2.0 or +2.0 (C or F depending on Parameter No.20) to induce automatic report or setting a value of 2 will be a change of 0.2(C or F). Available Settings: 0 to 250.

Value.label: Light intensity Threshold Value to Report
Value.Help: Change threshold value for change in lux to induce an automatic report for light sensor.

Value.label: Temperature Sensor Report Interval
Value.Help: This parameter is configured the time interval for temperature sensor report. This value is larger, the battery life is longer. And the temperature value changed is not obvious.

Value.label: Light Sensor Report Interval
Value.Help: This parameter is configured the time interval for light sensor report. This value is larger, the battery life is longer. And the light intensity changed is not obvious.

Value.label: Temperature Offset Value
Value.Help: The current measuring temperature value can be add and minus a value by this setting. The scale can be decided by Parameter Number 20. Temperature Offset Value = [Value] * 0.1(Celsius / Fahrenheit) Available Settings: -200 to 200.

Value.label: Light Intensity Offset Value
Value.Help: The current measuring light intensity value can be add and minus a value by this setting. Available Settings: -1000 to 1000.

Value.label: Light Sensor Calibrated Coefficient
Value.Help: This configuration defines the calibrated scale for ambient light intensity. Because the method and position that the sensor mounted and the cover of sensor will bring measurement error, user can get more real light intensity by this parameter setting. User should run the steps as blows for calibrating 1) Set this parameter value to default (Assumes the sensor has been added in a Z- Wave Network). 2) Place a digital light meter close to sensor and keep the same direction, monitor the light intensity value (Vm) which report to controller and record it. The same time user should record the value (Vs) of light meter. 3) The scale calibration formula: k = Vm / Vs. 4) The value of k is then multiplied by 1024 and rounded to the nearest whole number. 5) Set the value getting in 5) to this parameter, calibrate finished. For example, Vm = 300, Vs = 2600, then k = 2600 / 300 = 8.6667 k = 8.6667 * 1024 = 8874.7 => 8875. The parameter should be set to 8875.

Value.label: LED Light
Value.Help: Sets when the LED on the switch is lit.

Value.label: Invert Switch
Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON, if the switch was installed upside down.

Value.label: Z-Wave Command Dim Step
Value.Help: Indicates how many levels the dimmer will change for each dimming step.

Value.label: Z-Wave Command Dim Rate
Value.Help: This value indicates in 10 millisecond resolution, how often the dim level will change. For example, if you set this parameter to 1, then every 10ms the dim level will change. If you set it to 255, then every 2.55 seconds the dim level will change.

Value.label: Local Control Dim Step
Value.Help: Indicates how many levels the dimmer will change for each dimming step.

Value.label: Local Control Dim Rate
Value.Help: This value indicates in 10 millisecond resolution, how often the dim level will change. For example, if you set this parameter to 1, then every 10ms the dim level will change. If you set it to 255, then every 2.55 seconds the dim level will change.

Value.label: ALL ON/ALL OFF Dim Step
Value.Help: Indicates how many levels the dimmer will change for each dimming step.

Value.label: ALL ON/ALL OFF Dim Rate
Value.Help: This value indicates in 10 millisecond resolution, how often the dim level will change. For example, if you set this parameter to 1, then every 10ms the dim level will change. If you set it to 255, then every 2.55 seconds the dim level will change.

For example, Vm = 300, Vs = 2600, then k = 2600 / 300 = 8.6667 k = 8.6667 * 1024 = 8874.7 => 8875. The parameter should be set to 8875.

Value.label: LED Light
Value.Help: Sets when the LED on the switch is lit.

Value.label: Invert Switch
Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON, if the switch was installed upside down.

Value.label: Z-Wave Command Dim Step
Value.Help: Indicates how many levels the dimmer will change for each dimming step.

Value.label: Z-Wave Command Dim Rate
Value.Help: This value indicates in 10 millisecond resolution, how often the dim level will change. For example, if you set this parameter to 1, then every 10ms the dim level will change. If you set it to 255, then every 2.55 seconds the dim level will change.

Value.Help: Change the top of the switch to OFF and the bottom of the switch to ON, if the switch was installed upside down.

Value.label: Z-Wave Command Dim Step
Value.Help: Indicates how many levels the dimmer will change for each dimming step.

Value.label: Z-Wave Command Dim Rate
Value.Help: This value indicates in 10 millisecond resolution, how often the dim level will change. For example, if you set this parameter to 1, then every 10ms the dim level will change. If you set it to 255, then every 2.55 seconds the dim level will change.

Value.label: Local Control Dim Step
Value.Help: Indicates how many levels the dimmer will change for each dimming step.

Value.label: Local Control Dim Rate
Value.Help: This value indicates in 10 millisecond resolution, how often the dim level will change. For example, if you set this parameter to 1, then every 10ms the dim level will change. If you set it to 255, then every 2.55 seconds the dim level will change.

Value.label: ALL ON/ALL OFF Dim Step
Value.Help: Indicates how many levels the dimmer will change for each dimming step.

Value.label: ALL ON/ALL OFF Dim Rate
Value.Help: This value indicates in 10 millisecond resolution, how often the dim level will change. For example, if you set this parameter to 1, then every 10ms the dim level will change. If you set it to 255, then every 2.55 seconds the dim level will change.

Value.label: Overload Protection
Value.Help: Overload protection.

Value.label: On/Off Status Recovery After Power Failure
Value.Help: Choose the recovery state for your Power Switch if power outage occurs.

Value.label: On/Off Status Change Notifications
Value.Help: Send On/Off Status Change Notifications

Item.label: Sends notification if status is changed manually or remotely
Sends notification ONLY if status is changed manually

Value.label: LED Indicator Control
Value.Help: 0 - LED indicator will display power consumption whenever the device is plugged in. 1 - LED indicator will display the level of power consumption for 5 seconds only whenever the device is turned on or off

Item.label: Display whenever the device is plugged in (Default)

Value.label: Power Report Value Threshold
Value.Help: Number of Watts the appliance needs to go over for the change to be reported

Value.label: Power Report Percentage Threshold
Value.Help: Percentage in power usage change the appliance needs to go over for the event to be reported (Default 10)

Value.label: Power Report Frequency
Value.Help: Number of seconds

Value.label: Energy Report Frequency
Value.Help: Number of seconds

Value.label: Voltage Report Frequency
Value.Help: Number of seconds

Value.label: Electricity Report Frequency
Value.Help: Number of seconds
